data.title: Weekend in Portsmouth
data.text:
My husband who is a sports junkie wanted to see this museum while we were in town for a wedding.  The museum was laid out very nicely and we particularly liked the college section since our son attended one of the schools.
However there was some serious mistakes in the museum and we pointed them out on our way out.  In this day you would think someone who checked name spelling and video and audio accuracy.

data.title: Fun times with teens
data.text:
The kids loved the second floor of the museum.  Up here, one can test ones jumping skills, reaction skills, pitch softballs and baseballs to see how fast you can pitch, kick soccer balls into the goal obstructed by props in the shape of men, throw footballs through accuracy targets, play basketball  in a small gym area with 3 hoops at different levels and compete against your family in a car arcade racing game.  We went early on Saturday morning and had the whole place to ourselves so the kids were a little wild and crazy in there.
Downstairs are a lot of jerseys, leotards and outfits worn by some of the sports people and a TV screen area where you can record yourself reading from a prompt calling a football game and then play it back to hear how you sound.   It’s a fun hour or more if you just let the kids play in the upstairs area.

data.title: For the student of Virginia spots history
data.text: As a fan of sports, I felt like I was living the events depicted with various pieces of memorabilia all over again....and it was as much fun the second time around.  That said, it is a very nice tribute to the many athletes Virginia has produced across the gamut of sports, but a bit pricey as I left thinking, "...is that it?"  Again, what they have is very interesting and brought back memories, but could I could go for a dollar or two knocked off of the price.  If you/ve never been in a NASCAR simulator, this is a fun exhibit.  My sons enjoyed the baseball/football throwing exhibits. I found the golf section very interesting.

data.title: Fun for all
data.text: Great experience for sports enthusiasts.   Opportunities abound to test your abilities.  Interesting aspects for the whole family.

data.title: june 2013
data.text: very nice place to see all the history of all the local folks who have made it to pro in the sports department some locals i knew and some i didn't

data.title: Very nice museum
data.text: Great place for those to go who don't know much about Virginia sports and some of the greats from Virginia. The layout is pretty nice and easy to navigate. They also have a few sporting activities to participate in like the basketball court, baseball throw, and football throw area to name a few. A great place to go for museum lovers and a cool place to visit if you're ever in downtown Portsmouth.

data.title: Great place for sports lovers!
data.text: I am not really into sports, but still enjoyed the exhibits.  I especially enjoyed the Olympic section and the race car simulators.

data.title: Nice Place
data.text: Went there for the first time.....the staff was very friendly...the price is good for this attraction...they have senior,Triple A, and military discounts...Didn't know what to expect but enjoyed learning about the athletes from the area....this facility is well laid out...and really shows the talent of so many athletes...from car racing to golf, you name it....it is here......They also have some interactive things the kids can do...even the adults can try their hand at throwing a football or kick a soccer ball....they also give you tokens so you can try out the race car simulator....that was fun!!!! Definitely take the kids and have some fun.

data.title: A wonderful history lesson for the grandchildren
data.text: When the grandchildren came to visit this is one of the first places that I took them to. The facility is laid out for each age group to see and participate in. You are guaranteed to get a good workout trying to keep up with the grandchildren along with everyone getting a history lesson along the way. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

data.title: Who knew?
data.text: I don't understand why this museum isn't in Richmond, but I'm grateful that it's not.  I was surprised at the diversity of sports represented and how many athletes came from Virginia.  I'm looking forward to my nephews coming to visit to test out their skills.

data.title: Such a great experience
data.text: this museum celebrates athletes from Virginia in an engaging way.  Very well done and inspiring too.  A real pleasure to learn and experience.  Would highly recommend.

data.title: It could be better
data.text: This is an ok museum.  I could be better if they offered more hands on activities for family's.  Also, the ones they do have are not always opened.  If the museum is open, everything in it should be.  It good to see one time but I wouldn't go back over and over like some.

data.title: VA Sports Hall of Fame
data.text: After taking the water taxi from Downtown Norfolk VA, It was a quick walk to the Virginia Sports Hall of Fame and Museum. The museum is 2 floors. A lot to memorable of the Virginia  players. Any sports fame would enjoy this museum. There is some interactivity for the kids to enjoy.

data.title: Not worth the money
data.text: Place has facts and memorabilia that a sports enthusiast may enjoy. Lots of interactive things to do, but most of them are broken and/or not working. Took my family of 5 less then an hour to be in n out. I won't go back.

data.title: Very small
data.text: The actual Hall of fame is down stairs and really really small but still had a lot of interesting items. It's really not for adults its all about the kids. It really doesn't take that long to go through the entire thing maybe like an hour.

data.title: Good, especially for local sports enthusiasts.
data.text: I took my daughters there for my first visit (they have previously been) & it was about what I expected for the money.  Many interesting facts & interactive play.  I do think that they need to update & maintain it better though.  Several things were not working (theater, Nascar games, treadmill) & the soccer balls had the stuffing hanging out & the nets were ripped up.  I do have to say that all of the employees were awesome.  We were only there for just over an hour, but we were also the only people in the museum.

data.title: not much to do
data.text: took our kids here and we were in and out with in an hour... not really worth the money.  When we went it was full of rude people who every other word was F this and N!@@er that... not what I want to deal with

data.title: Great family fun
data.text: As Va natives, this museum was very informative of all the great athletes VA.  Grandchildren loved the interactive games, all sports highlighted.  We had the museum to ourselves so is is truly a hidden jewel in Portsmouth

data.title: Interactive learning experience
data.text: I decided to take my husband here because he loves sports and he had a blast. At first he was skeptical but in the end we both had a ton of fun. We really enjoyed the room downstairs were you can pretty much record and play commmenter for some of the sporting events. We spent at least 30 minutes in that room alone. The upstairs was pretty awesome too I really enjoyed the Bon Secours room with the skeleton figure on the bicycle. I had fun doing the nascar simulator even though I sucked at it. The room where you can throw the baseball, football and kick the soccer ball is pretty neat to. Also I forgot they have a basketball court inside which really surprised me. I truly enjoyed this muesum and we are going back soon. I think this place is great for kids especially if they appreciate sports history. We went on a Saturday and it was not super packed and the parking garage is free on the weekends.

data.title: A small museum with plenty of enjoyment
data.text: The museum is a must for Virginia sports fans.  Interactive displays are found throughout the museum with things to do for both the young and young of heart.
